usefulItems: madeleine tray, wire rack, jug, pastry brush, oven
title: Jaffa madeleines

ingredients.content: 100 g unsalted butter, softened and cut into pieces
1 orange, zest only, no white pith
60 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting

preparations.content: Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a jug and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place sugar, eggs, orange zest and salt into mixing bowl and beat <b>4 min/speed 4<b>. Meanwhile, use approx. 1 tablespoon of the melted butter and a pastry brush to grease a 12-hole madeleine tray, then dust with flour, shaking out any excess. Set aside.
<b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Add flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and remaining melted butter and mix <b>5 sec/speed 3<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>3 sec/speed 3<b> or until just combined. Divide mixture between madeleine moulds and bake for 8-10 minutes (170°C) or until madeleines spring back when lightly pressed in the centre. Remove from oven, cool in the tin for 2 minutes, then transfer onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar to serve (see Tips).

hintsAndTricks: To make your own icing sugar, please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook.
Madeleines are best eaten on the day they are made.
